title: UrbanDaddy
text:
UrbanDaddy is a company based in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York</a> which published content about men's <a href="luxury%20goods">luxury</a> lifestyle topics. As of August 2012, its websites and newsletters have more than 4.5 million subscriber in ten U.S. markets. UrbanDaddy publishes a daily email newsletter covering a single piece of news pertaining to <a href="nightlife">nightlife</a>, food and dining as well as <a href="Lifestyle%20%28sociology%29">lifestyle</a> and <a href="entertainment">entertainment</a>. The company is privately held, with a <a href="business%20model">business model</a> supported by advertising revenue and <a href="e-commerce">e-commerce</a>.
History.
UrbanDaddy was founded in 2005, by CEO Lance Broumand. Broumand left a career in <a href="law">law</a> to start UrbanDaddy. In addition to UrbanDadddy's lifestyle content the company also publishes reports about <a href="Luxury%20vehicle">luxury automobiles</a> on a web site called Driven.com and editorial focused on men's style on GetKempt.com. In 2011, UrbanDaddy launched Manero, a digital publication and <a href="social%20club">social club</a> for Latin Americans living in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
